aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The defining event was loss of control on ground during takeoff.
The incident involved a runway excursion during rejected takeoff.
The incident involved loss of control on ground during rejected takeoff.
The incident involved a collision during takeoff/land.
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot was 55 years old.
The pilot held airplane ratings for single-engine land.
The pilot held airplane ratings for single-engine sea.
The pilot held airplane ratings for multi-engine land.
The pilot occupied the front seat.
The pilot held helicopter aircraft rating.
The pilot used a 4-point restraint.
The pilot held instrument ratings for airplane.
The pilot held instrument ratings for helicopter.
A second pilot was present during the incident.
The pilot held instructor ratings for airplane single-engine.
The pilot held instructor ratings for helicopter.
The pilot held instructor ratings for instrument helicopter.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held Class 2 medical certification without waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration medical exam was on August 25, 2014.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on February 12, 2014.
The pilot had 5000 hours total flight time across all aircraft.
The pilot had 200 hours total flight time in this make and model.
The pilot had 3500 hours as Pilot In Command across all aircraft.
The pilot had 30 hours flight time in the last 90 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 15 hours flight time in the last 30 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 2 hours flight time in the last 24 hours across all aircraft.
The second pilot held Airline transport certificate.
The second pilot held Flight instructor certificate.
The second pilot occupied the rear seat.
The second pilot was an occupational pilot.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight

| Takeoff | Loss of control on ground (Defining event) |
| Takeoff-rejected takeoff | Runway excursion |
| Takeoff-rejected takeoff | Loss of control on ground |
| Takeoff-rejected takeoff | Collision during takeoff/land |

## Pilot Information

| Certificate: | Commercial |
| Age: | 55 |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Single-engine sea; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Front |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Helicopter |
| Restraint Used: | 4-point |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane; Helicopter |
| Second Pilot Present: | Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane single-engine; Helicopter; Instrument helicopter |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 2 Without waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | August 25, 2014 |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | February 12, 2014 |
| Flight Time: | 5000 hours (Total, all aircraft), 200 hours (Total, this make and model), 3500 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 30 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 15 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 2 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft) |

## Other flight crew Information

| Certificate: | Airline transport; Flight instructor |
| Age: |  |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Seat Occupied: Rear |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Restraint Used:  |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Second Pilot Present: Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | Toxicology Performed: No |
| Medical Certification: | Last FAA Medical Exam: |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: |  |
| Flight Time: |  |
